java.code: package Others; import java.io.BufferedReader; import java.io.InputStreamReader; /** @author Varun Upadhyay (https://github.com/varunu28) */ public class RemoveDuplicateFromString { public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception { BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in)); String inpStr = br.readLine(); System.out.println("Actual string is: " + inpStr); System.out.println("String after removing duplicates: " + removeDuplicate(inpStr)); br.close(); } /** * This method produces a string after removing all the duplicate characters from input string and * returns it Example: Input String - "aabbbccccddddd" Output String - "abcd" * * @param s String from which duplicate characters have to be removed * @return string with only unique characters */ public static String removeDuplicate(String s) { if (s == null || s.isEmpty()) { return s; } StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(); int n = s.length(); for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) { if (sb.toString().indexOf(s.charAt(i)) == -1) { sb.append(String.valueOf(s.charAt(i))); } } return sb.toString(); } }
